alert.note: Alert for Giles; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski, eastern Giles and northwestern Montgomery Counties and the City of Radford through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Narrows to near Radford. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may result in localized flooding in low-lying and normally flood prone, poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roads and highways is likely. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Christiansburg... Radford... Pearisburg... Narrows... Pembroke... and Newport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
